image-alt.explanation: All elements must have an alt attribute. The alt text should describe the image content or function. For decorative images, use alt="".

label.explanation: Every form input must have an associated <label>. Use the 'for' attribute on the label to match the 'id' of the input.

color-contrast.explanation: Text must have sufficient contrast against its background. WCAG AA requires 4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text (18pt+ or 14pt+ bold).

html-has-lang.explanation: The <html> element must have a lang attribute to specify the page's primary language. This helps screen readers pronounce content correctly.

heading-order.explanation: Heading levels should not be skipped. After an <h1>, use <h2>, not <h3>. This creates a logical document outline.

link-name.explanation: Link text should be meaningful and describe the destination. Avoid generic phrases like 'click here' or 'read more'.

button-name.explanation: Buttons must have accessible names. If using only an icon, add visually-hidden text or use aria-label.

list.explanation: Use semantic list elements (<ul>, <ol>) for lists of items. This helps screen readers announce item counts and navigation.

aria-label.explanation: When a button contains only an icon or non-text content, use aria-label to provide an accessible name.

variables.type: Appropriate input type (email, tel, url, number, etc.)
variables.name: Input name

input-type.explanation: Use semantic input types (email, tel, url) for better mobile keyboards and built-in validation. Add autocomplete for common fields.

landmark.explanation: Use semantic HTML5 elements (<header>, <nav>, <main>, <footer>) or ARIA landmark roles to define page regions.

table-headers.explanation: Use <th> for table headers with appropriate scope attribute. Structure tables with <thead> and <tbody> for clarity.

skip-link.template: Skip to main content
skip-link.after: Skip to main content
skip-link.explanation: Add a skip link as the first focusable element to let keyboard users bypass navigation and jump to main content.

focus-visible.explanation: Never remove focus indicators completely. Always provide visible focus styles for keyboard navigation. Use outline or box-shadow.

aria-prohibited-attr.explanation: Certain ARIA attributes cannot be used on elements with specific roles. For example, aria-label is not allowed on elements with role="none" or role="presentation". Remove the prohibited ARIA attribute or change the role.

aria-required-attr.explanation: Elements with ARIA roles must have all required ARIA attributes. For example, role="checkbox" requires aria-checked. Check the ARIA specification for required attributes for each role.

aria-valid-attr-value.explanation: ARIA attributes must have valid values according to the ARIA specification. For example, aria-pressed accepts 'true', 'false', or 'mixed', not 'yes' or 'no'.

region.explanation: Elements with role="region" must have an accessible name. Use aria-labelledby to reference a heading, or aria-label to provide a label.
